original: EDENHOLM, Ivar Henrik Verner, Professor, Stockholm, f Göteryd, Kronob l, 19/8 01 av disp E G Swensson o Hulda Edenholm, gm Anna-Greta Petrini. Studex Kristianst 18, KTH (maskinbygg o mek tekn) 19—24. i:e ass KTH:s ångtekn lab 24—27, rektors bitr v underyisn i ångtekn KTH 27—31, d:o i läran om värmemotorer ht 28, ing AB Ljungströms Ångturbin 28—31, ing IVA:s ångvärmeinst 31 —33, förest f detta 34—40, nu prof KTH. Av trycket: The flame radiation in watercooled boiler furnaces (tills m T Lindmark i IVA:s handl 27), Laboratory test results with diffe-rent types of heating elements for Ljungström^ air preheaters (tills m A Lysholm, Världskraftkonf i Tokyo 29), ett flert upps i facktidskr. IVA 34—38. Led Sv Tekn.frn.
translated: EDENHOLM, Ivar Henrik Verner, Professor, Stockholm, born in Göteryd, Kronoberg county, on August 19, 1901 to parents E. G. Swensson and Hulda Edenholm. Married to Anna-Greta Petrini. Graduated from Kristianstad in 1918. Studied at KTH (Royal Institute of Technology) in mechanical engineering from 1919 to 1924. Assistant at KTH's steam technology laboratory from 1924 to 1927. Deputy to the rector for teaching in steam technology at KTH from 1927 to 1931. Also taught heat engines in the autumn of 1928. Engineer at AB Ljungström's Steam Turbine from 1928 to 1931. Engineer at IVA's (Royal Swedish Academy of Engineering Sciences) steam heating institute from 1931 to 1933. Head of the same institute from 1934 to 1940. Currently a professor at KTH. Published works include: "The flame radiation in water-cooled boiler furnaces" (co-authored with T. Lindmark in IVA's proceedings in 1927), "Laboratory test results with different types of heating elements for Ljungström's air preheaters" (co-authored with A. Lysholm, presented at the International Power Conference in Tokyo in 1929), and several articles in technical journals from 1934 to 1938. Member of the Royal Swedish Academy of Engineering Sciences.
